result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy Yang

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Dismissal/Acquittal mailed to defendant at the Columbia County Jail and was returned marked "return to sender, inmate not here"

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tommy Yang in court in custody from the Columbia County Jail.  Attorney Donald Ritchey Stroud III in court for Tommy Yang. Cases called: 21 CM 591, 21 CM 592, 22 CF 2 and 22 CF 86, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 21 CM 591, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 in 21 CM 591, 21 CM 592, 22 CF 2 and 22 CF 86 dismissed, read in, Court sentences defendant to: 21 CM 591, Ct. 1, 240 days jail w/Huber to commence forthwith, $453.00 costs due in 60 days or payment plan, $184.60 Restitution, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, 22 days sentence credit, bond to be applied
re: sentence credit filed by Atty Stroud
